Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json." (#8903) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

### Describe the bug

[nuget.org] Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json.
  An error occurred while sending the request.
  The underlying connection was closed: Could not establish trust relationship for the SSL/TLS secure channel.
  The remote certificate is invalid according to the validation procedure.
Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json.

### Repro Steps

1 use the VS2019(Microsoft Visual Studio Enterprise 2019 Version 16.11.7) and VS2022 create a Console App
2 manage Nuget Packages and Click the Browse tab
3 the Error occurred

### Expected Behavior

can load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json. And can install the common nuget package

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20280108/144606316-079232ed-9ad2-4943-b4da-35acde6fe912.png)


### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Adjust text on details field in Report Package form." (#8882) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Add this text after the request for details sentence for safety violations: “Please also describe where in the package the problem was found.”

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Additional online safety instructions in report package page" (#8902) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8899

This change instructs the reporter of abuse to include specifics that will help us address the problem quickly. The other accommodations for online safety reporting (no contact checkbox, additional detail for imminent harm reporting, revenge porn portal directions) are all preserved.

![kBIKcd1FzY](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14225979/144378864-5f4ee6cb-9eb1-4010-96f6-897488b74cf5.gif)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Re-add a11y to checkmarks and bangs in package details page" (#8901) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8897

Adds the popovers into the new v2 package details page for reserved checkmarks (including alt tag) and vulnerable/deprecated bangs. Narrator support also restored, and there needed to be tab stops added to ID and version.

This video cuts out at the reserved checkmark but you get the idea from the bangs demo (I pause and point at the changes):
![rsUt0o3FSu](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14225979/144371751-31af68b5-3076-4117-8a9a-489c7c14310c.gif)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: Some packets are pushed slowly to nuget.server" (#8900) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

MSBuild.exe, NuGet.exe

### Product Version

nuget.exe 5.11.0.10, msbuild  16.11.1.47101, nuget.server 3.4.1.0

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

1. step one: create some nupkg packages using msbuild xml.  The following code is used to build the package

`<MSBuild Projects="$(BuildSolutionDir)/Mares.Scheduler.Api.Client/Mares.Scheduler.Api.Client.csproj" Targets="Restore" />
<MSBuild Projects="$(BuildSolutionDir)/Mares.Scheduler.Api.Client/Mares.Scheduler.Api.Client.csproj"
				 Targets="Build;Pack"	Properties="Configuration=$(Configuration);PackageOutputPath=$(NuGetPackageDir);Authors=$(Authors);Version=$(Version)" />`


2. step two: push packages with a powershell script to nuget server (hosted in iis 10).  some package need 250ms to be pushed, other need more than 30sec.  The following is the code I use to push the package

`$PackagePath = "$(Get-Location)\Packages"
Get-ChildItem $PackagePath -Filter *.nupkg|
Foreach-Object {
    Invoke-Expression "$($NugetPath) push $($_.FullName) -Source $($NugetApi) -ApiKey $($NugetApiKey) -Verbosity detailed" 
    Remove-Item $_.FullName
}`

The strange behaviour occur when publishing new packets and when replacing existing packets.  It looks like nuget server rebuild some cache


### Verbose Logs

```shell
NuGet Version: 5.11.0.10
Pushing Mares.Scheduler.Api.Client.3.0.2.nupkg to 'http://192.168.34.200:81/api/v2/package'...
  PUT http://192.168.34.200:81/api/v2/package/
  Created http://192.168.34.200:81/api/v2/package/ 45121ms
Your package was pushed.
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add additional text to use of online safety categories in report package form" (#8899) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Add this text above the details box when a safety category is chosen:

Please also describe where in the package the problem was found. 

Be sure to include:
-	Whether the problem is in graphics, video, readme, scripts, libraries, nuspec, other metadata, other file(s).
-	The exact names of the offending file(s).


/cc @jcjiang

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Add open.vscode.dev to allowed domains for images and badges" (#8898) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

The open.vscode.dev domain is not included in the list of [allowed domains for images and badges](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/nuget-org/package-readme-on-nuget-org#allowed-domains-for-images-and-badges) for package readme files. This breaks loading "_Open in Visual Studio Code_" badges, with only the alt text being displayed. It's a minor cosmetic issue, but if there's no security concerns it would be nice to have the domain added to the allow list. It is a Microsoft owned domain.

### Repro Steps

Upload any package with an included readme and an _Open in Visual Studio Code_ badge referencing the open.vscode.dev domain.

### Expected Behavior

Loads the _Open in Visual Studio Code_ badge.

### Screenshots

Current:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3214803/144153559-ee29caaf-d01c-4483-8a20-05b820db1173.png)

Desired:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3214803/144153625-4e6173ca-5d65-4aaa-9cba-931ff24f8fd2.png)


### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feature]:  Syntax Highlighting for code example in Readme.md" (#8894) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

The code examples on .nuget have no syntax highlighting. In some case this might be confusing for users.


### The Elevator Pitch

Add Syntax Highlighting for code examples at readme.md. (Like the one here on github)

### Additional Context and Details

Example:

 C# Code:
```C#
public class Foo {
  public string GetBar() => "bar";
}

```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ContentItemCollection uses yield return which is causing over-allocation of Enumerators" (#10921) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
ContentItemCollection uses yield return in its FindItems code path which is causing over-allocation of Enumerators. What happens with yield return is the compiler creates a type based on the method where the yield is happening, and it derives from Enumerators and at runtime it allocates an Enumerator to handle the foreach iteration. When this is done on a hot code path, as is the case here, it allocates many objects that derive from Enumerator. When restoring with OrchardCore as a solution the following allocations are made:

```
Name                                	Exc %	Exc	Exc Ct	Inc %	           Inc
Type <FindItemGroups>d__7           	     	   	      	  1.9	   170,492,112
Type <FindItemsImplementation>d__10 	     	   	      	  1.3	   119,705,840
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add progress reporting during package installation" (#11432) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Follow up to: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/9782

In order to keep the changes manageable, the progress reporting for package installation/uninstallation/updates will be added separately.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Using the IntermediateOutputPath in an application and deleting the obj directory near the project source breaks the build." (#7362) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):
VS UI

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):
4.6.0

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):
15.8.5

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):
win10 1803

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create a Xamarin.Android app,
2. Apply the IntermediateOutputPath tweak i.e. append something like this into the .csproj file:
```
  <PropertyGroup>
    <IntermediateOutputPath>C:\Temp\project1</IntermediateOutputPath>
  </PropertyGroup>
```
3. Switch the project to the packages.config style of NuGet reference (like most of the pre-existing projects do).
4. Delete the now-old obj directory which should exist near the .csproj file.
5. Rebuild the app project.

## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs
------ Rebuild All started: Project: PGPolyglotRussian3.Droid, Configuration: Release Any CPU ------
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Enterprise\MSBuild\15.0\Microsoft.Common.targets\ImportAfter\Xamarin.Common.targets(39,3): error MSB3371: The file "obj\project.assets.json.stamp" cannot be created. Could not find a part of the path '\obj\project.assets.json.stamp'.
========== Rebuild All: 0 succeeded, 1 failed, 0 skipped ==========

In order to make the project build you will have to manually create the **obj** folder near the project file and create an empty **project.assets.json.stamp** file inside.

### Sample Project
[Problem1.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/2447970/Problem1.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "restore3 should display a friendly message when failing due to malformed nuget.config" (#3704) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):
NuGet Command Line 3.6.0.0

dotnet.exe --version (if appropirate):

.NET Command Line Tools (1.0.0-preview3)

Product Information:
 Version:            1.0.0-preview3
 Commit SHA-1 hash:  a9a6a72bc8

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Mac OS X
 OS Version:  10.12
 OS Platform: Darwin
 RID:         osx.10.11-x64

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:
No
## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
1. Create a nuget.config file that points to a non-existent local path
2. restore a csproj in the context of this nuget.config

The command fails, as it should, but with a very large stack trace. It would be much better if the condition were handled gracefully with a meaningful message for the user.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet restore via VS gives different warnings vs msbuild restore" (#5261) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
**Build:** Version 15.3.0-pre.1.0+26521.1.d15prerel

1. `git clone http://github.com/dotnet/project-system`
2. `cd project-system`
3. `git checkout 162e76d7626ef3e6369a6614a9084a607c30bd1e`
4. `build.cmd` -> which restores (notice no errors/warnings - bin\debug\logs\Restore.log for log)
5. Open src\ProjectSystem.sln
6. Wait for restore to finish

**Expected:** Command-Line and VS to have the same set of warnings/errors
**Actual:**

Command-line has no warnings
Visual Studio has the following warnings:

```
Detected package downgrade: Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServices from 2.3.0-beta2-61711-06 to 2.3.0-beta1-61703-10 
 DeployIntegrationDependencies (>= 1.0.0) -> Microsoft.VisualStudio.IntegrationTest.Utilities (>= 2.3.0-beta2-61711-06) -> Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServices (>= 2.3.0-beta2-61711-06) 
 DeployIntegrationDependencies (>= 1.0.0) -> Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServices (>= 2.3.0-beta1-61703-10)
Detected package downgrade: Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServices from 2.3.0-beta2-61711-06 to 2.3.0-beta1-61703-10 
 Microsoft.VisualStudio.ProjectSystem.IntegrationTests (>= 1.0.0) -> Microsoft.VisualStudio.IntegrationTest.Utilities (>= 2.3.0-beta2-61711-06) -> Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServices (>= 2.3.0-beta2-61711-06) 
 Microsoft.VisualStudio.ProjectSystem.IntegrationTests (>= 1.0.0) -> Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServices (>= 2.3.0-beta1-61703-10)
```

We have warnings as errors turned on, but command-line didn't catch the above issue - so this got merged in.
